Description: Shoulder sherd of Fikellura pottery amphora; white slip; glaze fired red-brown; exterior: bird (body, tail, and wings remaining) to right; below, dividing band of dots and vertical bars between pairs of bands; below, part of lotus flower.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 140-1, Nau 107, pl. 23f-g)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 245)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.061)
